translations: by (metis local.comp_anti local.conjugate_r_def local.conv1 local.double_compl local.res_rc1)

text \<open>
  Similarly, for $x^\smile = 1 \lhd x$, since $x \rhd 1 = 1 \lhd x$ when
  $x \rhd 1 \rhd 1 = x$ holds.
\<close>

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (1::'a) \<lhd> x \<squnion> y =
    ((1::'a) \<lhd> x) \<squnion> ((1::'a) \<lhd> y)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (1::'a) \<lhd> x \<cdot> y =
    ((1::'a) \<lhd> y) \<cdot> ((1::'a) \<lhd> x)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. ((1::'a) \<lhd> x) \<cdot> - (x \<cdot> y) \<le> - y

text \<open>
  Since the previous axioms are equivalent when multiplication is associative
  in a residuated boolean monoid, one of them are sufficient to
  derive a relation algebra.
\<close>

class residuated_ra = residuated_boolean_monoid +
  assumes conv: "x \<rhd> y = (x \<rhd> 1)\<cdot>y"
begin

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>x y. x \<lhd> y = x \<cdot> ((1::'a) \<lhd> y)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>x y. x \<lhd> y = x \<cdot> ((1::'a) \<lhd> y)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x \<lhd> y = x \<cdot> ((1::'a) \<lhd> y)

proof (state)
this:
  x \<lhd> y = x \<cdot> ((1::'a) \<lhd> y)

goal:
No subgoals!

sublocale relation_algebra where
  composition = "(\<cdot>)" and unit = 1 and
  converse = "\<lambda>x. x \<rhd> 1"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. class.relation_algebra (-) uminus (\<sqinter>) (\<le>) (<) (\<squnion>)
     \<bottom> \<top> (\<cdot>) (\<lambda>x. x \<rhd> (1::'a)) (1::'a)

proof (state)
goal (7 subgoals):
 1. \<And>x y z. x \<cdot> y \<cdot> z = x \<cdot> (y \<cdot> z)
 2. \<And>x. x \<cdot> (1::'a) = x
 3. \<And>x y z.
       (x \<squnion> y) \<cdot> z = x \<cdot> z \<squnion> y \<cdot> z
 4. \<And>x. x \<rhd> (1::'a) \<rhd> (1::'a) = x
 5. \<And>x y.
       x \<squnion> y \<rhd> (1::'a) =
       (x \<rhd> (1::'a)) \<squnion> (y \<rhd> (1::'a))
 6. \<And>x y.
       x \<cdot> y \<rhd> (1::'a) =
       (y \<rhd> (1::'a)) \<cdot> (x \<rhd> (1::'a))
 7. \<And>x y. (x \<rhd> (1::'a)) \<cdot> - (x \<cdot> y) \<le> - y
